content.detailedDescription:
While shooting fireworks with friends, i noticed a bright orange orb travelling across the sky.  i pointed it out to the others who also saw it.  i thought it was a "luminaria" or ballon-type firework or perhaps a parachute flare.  the object seemed to be only 1-2k feet in altitude, and therefore not large.  as the object travelled across the sky in a general ese to wnw direction, i realized there was no wind to carry a balloon or parachute flare--the remnants of our firework mortars fell directly back to earth without drifitng away as would have happened with any breeze.

the object made no sound and did not flicker or strobe, but instead glowed brightly so that a bit of an aura or "haze" surrounded the object.  we watched the object until it travelled too far away to be observed.  at no time did we discern any change in direction or speed or altitude.

the event was not frightening, but was more of a curiousity.  i felt that with an optical device or better ambient light it might have been possible to better identify the object.  i would not have reported this except that i found so many other reported sightings of similar objects for this weekend...Perhaps something in this report can help corroborate of determine a cause for the phenomenon.
content.summary: Glowing orange orb.

content.detailedDescription: i was out back of the house on our deck relaxing after fire works and smores. it was quite and no planes were visible. i do live approx 45 min from pittsburgh airport but there was no visible traffic. on the 2 of july i went out back at night around 11pm to have a smoke and i looked up as i often do and i saw a star-like object move north-south in a straight line for almost the entire sky and then fade out. that was only the second time i have seen that in 10 years. saw one in florida 10 years ago do same thing. so on the night of the 4th i decided to look up to see if i could find any more and sure enough at a maximum altitude i saw one moving west to northeast but it faded out quickly this time. not more than ten minutes later i saw another moving in same direction and it faded out just as quick. i love to watch the night sky and have never seen anything like this. their altitude is what makes this very weird because there so high up u can hardly seem them and they blend in like a star if they were to stop it would just look like a star sitting still but because they move it's the only reason i noticed them. i know other people have witnessed this same thing and are shocked at first just like i was. i have no idea what the shape is because of the altitude and of coarse the was no sound either. the objects do not change color, speed or direction but do appear to change altitude because they fade in brightness. i do not believe i have witnessed planes , shooting stars, and i do not believe i am seeing satilites with the naked eye that dissapear. would love to here a solid explanation. thankyou
content.summary: High altitude star-like moving object.

content.detailedDescription: On july 4 2010 at 11:30pm an oval object was witnessed by myself (*name deleted--sgonzalez/cms) my girlfriend and another witness.It was first seen by myself as it cleared the trees of the nieghborhood we were in.There was cloud cover as it had been raining previosly.The object was travelling under the clouds and was higher(500 to 600 ft up)than the fireworks being set off that night.As it got closer i pointed it out to my girlfriend.We both noticed that it was flying faster than a helicopter but not as fast as a plane.It appeared to be about 40 to 50 ft across in size.It was glowing with a steady amber/orange color.It made no noise.It was oval in shape and travelled across the sky in about three minutes.Before i could call to more friends to see it,it was out of sight over the nieghbors house.I felt that it was a true unknown craft,and i still feel that.I wish i had a camera at the time.
content.summary: Oval object, glowing amber, flys over wichita,ks.

content.detailedDescription:
1. outside on deck star gazing/satellite gazing. 10:25 pm edt.
2. was observing a satellite moving over head and the orange object caught my eye.  it was to the south and well above the horizon when i saw it.
3.  immediate reaction was uncertainty, but the more i watched the more i thought it was a rocket launch from somewhere along the east coast.
4. the object glowed bright orange for several minutes, moving slightly to the east.  when the orange glow ended, the object remained briefly visible as a satellite type object.
5. my actions were to continue to watch it until it was no longer visible.  several other people saw it as well.
6. the object became dimmer and faded from view.
content.summary: Orange glow.

content.detailedDescription: Was watching neighborhood fireworks and saw a red-orange light moving across sky. at first thought it may a firework. realized quickly it was not. was concerned it may be a plane with its engines on fire. looked like it may have been three orange glowing orbs close together, but again could not tell because it was too bright to make out any detail. i would estimate altitude at under 5k. strangest part was that it made absolutely no noise at all. it moved from southwest-ish to northeast and then turned more north before i lost sight of it behind trees. i was not even going to report it here, but after looking at all the other orange glow reports from last night, felt it necessary. hope the news reports it... i know many other people must have seen this and don't know what to do about it.
content.summary: Orange-red glowing object across night sky.

content.detailedDescription: We just pulled up to our camp sight and began putting up our tents when my friend looked up and noticed something moving in a straight line slowly above our heads.  it was not very high, and it made no noises at all.  i saw it and the four children that were with us saw it as well and asked what it was.  i felt curious and anxious to know what it was.  we lost sight of it as it went past the trees.  my friend lived on an air base and has seen all of the different jets and helicpters there are and said he never saw a plane or chopper that looked like a fireball.
content.summary: Orange/red fireball.

content.detailedDescription: At approximately 2300hrs on the night of july 4, 2010 in dickson, tn: i was at a friends house for the evening visiting. we were in the backyard at approximately 2300hrs and one of my friends noticed something in the sky. when i looked up i seen an object in the sky coming from the west/southwest at a very slow rate of speed. it almost seemed to be "floating" and appeared to be very low, maybe 1500-2000ft elevation. the object was traveling towards us, or east/northeast. it appeared to be almost directly above us, then gradually turned back heading northwest. the object was amber or orange in color, and seemed to be sphere shaped. there were no apparent flashing lights, it was just one glowing light. no sounds were associated with this object, it was silent. no other aircraft were observed. i knew as soon as i had seen it that i was seeing something i had never seen before, beyond a shadow of a doubt. i have in the past seen objects in the sky and wondered what they were and was able to identify them. i am familiar with satellites, helicopters and other such various aircraft. it was clearly none of those. as for the size it was approximatley three to four times the size of the planet venus in the early evening sky. it made no sudden movements and was very smooth and slow.
content.summary: Orange in color. slow moving, low elevation. smooth movement, no sudden movement or side to side.

content.detailedDescription: Myself (father) and family and friends,7 total were in front yard shooting aerial fireworks along with neighbors across the street from us. we will in a friendly competition to see who had the biggest, most showy aerial firework. we had been lighting up the sky for 40 minutes or so prior to the sighting. it had been raining and the sky was totally overcast with a low ceiling of clouds. i was about to light so more aerial shots as we were in the middle of our celebration and i saw a bright orange sphere or ball of light coming toward us from the southwest to the northeast. had it continued it;s course it would have traveled over and slightly in front of us. since it was orange and had no red or green nav lights or strobes, i knew it was not a normal aircraft. it was below the cloud ceiling i would guess about 1500-2000 ft. in height moving slowly towards our location and displays. i said to my group , hey look at the ufo and everyone looked at the craft coming . i had a bright flashlight in my hand and in hopes of luring the craft closer i aimed it at the craft and turned it on and off several times in rapid succession. to my disappointment instead of luring it closer it changed direction from sw to ne to a   west  direction and accelerated in speed and grew smaller in light as it flew off into the cloud deck to the west. the glow or light if this craft was as bright as a landing light on a private airplane coming directly at you at its brightest.
content.summary: Red glowing sphere.

content.detailedDescription: Was watching "neighborhood" (next-door type) fireworks and my daughter and i saw a very bright red/orange "blob" of light. kind of looked like three orbs together, but it was so bright it was hard to tell an actual shape. at first it looked like a firework, but we soon realized it was a craft of some sort that was traveling from the southwest to the east-northeast. constant rate of speed, straight line, then slow left to north-northeast, then we lost sight of it behind trees. absolutely no noise of any kind. struck me odd because it was not that high up in the sky, and i was hoping to hear either a propeller or a jet engine. we live near an airport (and have for twenty years) and are very familiar with all sorts of air traffic. this stood out as something i have never seen. i also saw the same type of thing was reported in florida the same night. weird. (and no, i was not drinking!)
content.summary: Red/orange bright light across sky.... no noise at all.

content.detailedDescription: My husband, myself and two friends were leaving to go to the fireworks around 8:15 july 4.  we saw 12 orange lights low in the sky, looked like they were shooting into orbit one at a time, and then slow down hanging out together. we left...Knowing we were seeing ufo's but went on over to the fireworks area in the neighborhood.  we had just arrived and walked down for the best view and one orange light came over the trees from the south and went straight over us, and then another and another.  they would get a ways over but still up over us and would go out.  then we noticed that their was a large black shadow floating and we thought at first it was soot from the fireworks but it was a flat object that floated to the north like the balls.  we then realized that the orange lights would go out and would turn into the flat black undiscernable shape object and had lights blinking on and off around in a circle around the outside of it. every light would go out and float away the same way.  we left the fireworks to try and get the binoculars and see it closer but they were gone.  my husband and *(name deleted--sgonzalez/cms)were outside still and two more floated over them.  they were calling **(name deleted--sgonzalez/cms)and me to come out but we were busy looking for pictures of what we had seen on youtube. the whole thing lasted about an hour.  i did count  lights when we saw them in the beginning and so i would think that all 12  came over us in the same path. i was so amazed that i had actually seen ufo's and so excited i didn't bother watching the fireworks.  nothing could top that!!!  i had a great 4th to say the least and will be watching the skies tonight for more of the same.
content.summary: 12 big orange lights moving in the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
On the night of july 4th, 2010 at approximatly 2220 hours pacific, myself and three others witnessed three amber colored fireballs float across the sky from the town of enumclaw in washington state.  the estimated time of the sighting is based off of having just returned from a local city fireworks show which ended at 2205.  
as we were unloading the truck back at my friends house, which is in a rural part of the county consisting of mostly farms, about five miles directly west of the downtown part of enumclaw, i noticed an amber/orangish light floating across the sky.  i was facing north and saw this first light traveling from west to east at about fifty degrees off the horizon.  the first thing that seemed unusual about it was the color.  i have lots of experience in aviation and it is unusual to see a single colored light not accompanied by other white or strobing lights.  this light seemed to flicker slightly, as though it was a ball on fire from the inside, but not trailing sparks or flames of any kind.  there was no noise accompanying the light such as what you would normaly hear from a general aviation or commercial aircraft.  the weather at the time is included below, and limits the object to travel under 3,000 feet in altitude such that if it were a ga or commercial aircraft you would be able to hear the engine from our location.  i called to my friends and pointed the light out to them after watching it for about 30 seconds.  after watching for a few seconds one friend pointed out a second light that had just appeared from the east side of the sky, also traveling west but a few degrees higher off the horizon than the first.  by this time the first light, about a minute into the sighting and now to the northeast in the sky suddenly dimmed and disapeared.  the second light also dimmed and dissapeared in the northeast about 45 seconds after it was first seen.  the third light was noticed right as the second was fading, this one travling from the north, up from the horizon, towards the northeast.  this third light at first appeared to be a firework being launched from a field in the distance where a small display was going on, but continued higher and higher and it became obvious that it was not a firework.  it arched its way up and about twenty degrees off the horizon began to weave slightly before disapearing 30 seconds later in about the same spot as the two others.  all three sightings occured withing the period of three minutes time.  we continued to watch the sky for a couple minutes longer but saw no more objects.  i remained alert throughout the rest of the night before heading inside around 0030 local time and noticed the white landing lights and strobes as well as the red and green wingtip lights of ga and commercial aircraft but saw no more amber/orange lights in the sky.
the only cameras that any of us had with us were cell phone cameras, which i attempted to capture an image with but was unable to get anything other than black sky and will not waste time uploading to this report as there was no evidence after reviewing.
in reveiwing the sighting with my friends, the lights seemed very reminicent of watching the iss travel across the sky.  the lights all appeared to be of similar size and brightness as the iss, but a much more orangeish/amberish color. due to the weather at the time of the sighting, any possibility of these being planets, satellites or any other high altitude objects was ruled out among us.  chinese lanterns were considered but wind patterns were not in favor of that possibility.
noaa nws history shows the weather at 2210 on july 4th to be winds west/southwest at 7 miles per hour.  clouds were few at 1,700 feet, broken at 2,600 feet and overcast at 3,200 feet with visabiliy 10 miles. weather at 2230 was winds west/southwest at 7 miles per hour.  clouds were overcast at 3,000 feet, visabiliy 10 miles.
content.summary: Three amber colored fireballs which slowly floated across the sky in a three minute period.

content.detailedDescription: I live in bethlehem pa and i was taking my dog for a walk around 9:15pm est and watching some neighborhood fireworks. as we returned to our street, i looked up to catch what i thought were more fireworks. except these four objects hovered overhead, didn't make any noise and didn't turn colors or lose their luster after a few seconds. i stopped to watch as the objects started to move east all at the same time. they kept the same direction and same speed for about a minute and then they sped up for a quick second and then continued at the slower speed until they were out of sight.  the whole event was probably about 5 minutes long. all 4 objects were uniform in all of their motions... almost seeming like they were tied together.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: 4 orange spheres moving uniformly in an eastern direction. slow at first, then picked up speed unit they were out of sight.

content.detailedDescription: My boyfriend and i were sitting on our back deck watching the fireworks (newark, de)around 10:15 p.M.  then all of the sudden we looked up and heading in a northerly direction were these 2 triangluar orange lights.  at first i thought them to be ashes or something to that effect from fireworks but my boyfriend said there is no way b/c of the way they were flying in too exact of a formation.  there was no sound, no blinking lights like it could have been planes.  he went inside and i was sitting there watching the sky and a single one flew over.  tried to get a picture, but nothing came up on the screen.  again it was heading in a northerly direction.  about 5 minutes later 2 more went by in the same direction.  to both of us they seemed to be small triangluar lights orange in color and my boyfriend seems to think the bottom of the first 2 were like a bright red. it was the strangest thing i ever saw and have ever experienced.  just seems like they flew over the house and then seemed to disappear once they got a little further away from where we were.  to be honest, i don't know what to think, i can't explain it.  the boyfriend who does believe in other life, believes they were ufo's.
content.summary: 5 orange triangle lights went by last night and then sort of disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: This is addendum with pictures of event previously reported.  two pictures taken towards end of event shows objects more clearly.  these were taken from in front of our house.  tree gives reference point.  note green objects accompanying them which were invisible to our eyes when we were observing reddish orange/white ufos on july 4, 2010 at approximately 11:25 pm.
content.summary: Pictures for sighting previously reported of 12-18 orange/white objects.

content.detailedDescription: My son came in from the deck, he had been watching fireworks, he said that he noticed a very large orange ball of light moving from southwest to northeast.  i figured it was an airplane, so i went out to investigate.  sure enough, there was a large orange ball of light moving, at what i would call cruising speed.  it was larger than what an airplane would be, and it was moving from southwest to northeast.  it cast an orange glow over our deck as it passed over.   it almost resembled a huge firework that wouldn't burn out.  we kept waiting for it to burn out and it never did.  it went directly over our house and it was completely silent!  it moved so far northeast that we could no longer see it.  i have never in my 38 years seen something so strange.  it was simply not explainiable, unless it was a metor burning out, but it wouldn't have lasted that long i wouldn't think.  it didn't blink like a gaseous ball the way stars do.    it was both exciting and scary at the same time.  hoping someone out there can track down some answers...
content.summary: Bright orange silent ball of light

content.detailedDescription: I was over at my friends house in lebanon, in for a cookout and 4th of july fun. no drinking or booze of anykind was allowed. we (around 20 friends)all moved our chairs out to the street at 10pm because we could see the fireworks from there and didn't have to mess with the traffic afterwards. after the firworks were done, one of our friends was sitting on a blanket by the street, and she just happened to look directly east and said what is that.  the fireworks lasted 20 minutes over lebanon, in so it was around 10:20 pm. it was huge reddish-orange ball of light moving from the sw to the ne..It was more orange than red but had a slight reddish tint. i mean it was huge. we dismissed it as a i don't know thing and shot some more fireworks.  then another one, then another one following the same path. seemed they were in a line formation. one of them seemed to circle the town as we watched it but then it seemed to follow the others in a north east direction. the speed seemed to be just crusing speed, whatever that would be for something like this. we then said, maybe it is chinese lanterns but when they hopped around in a up and down altitude dance and one circled the town, we didn't think any lanterns could do that. they were completely silent. there were 4 in total and whatever it was seemed very interested in what was going on over the town. if these were in fact chinese lanterns then they were the size of a big-butted hot air balloon if not bigger and certainly had maneuver capabilities.  just another something that we can't explain.
content.summary: Huge orange balls of light moving across lebanon, in.

content.detailedDescription: I first saw the object when my family and i were coming home from a firework show that the eagle run golf course puts on every year.  when i was looking threw the smoke from the fire works i look in the sky and saw the ufo in the sky at first i thought it was ether a planet or are a firework but then i stopped stop to get a better look at it and i realized that it was slowly moving.  as one of the guest got ready to go when i noticed the sphere vanished in to thin air.
content.summary: A red fire ball  directly south.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i are avid star watchers, every clear night we spend 3 to 4 hours with telescope and binoclers spotting satelights and other terestrial objects.  last night at 10:55 a bright orangish red ball that was bigger and faster than the iss has ever been traveled from the southern sky northeasterly until it was below our line of sight.  the iss was traveling last night at the same time but traveling nnw to ene so it wasn't the iss.  it seemed to curve from the south to east to northeast on a desending pattern, seemed bigger, brighter and faster than the iss.
content.summary: Bright orange-red ball traveling south to northeast, bigger and faster than iss.

content.detailedDescription: Approx. 9:20pm july 4th 2010, my wife and myself took our dogs out in the backyard. we were watching some neighborhood firework displays when my wife exclaimed "what the hell is that?". i turned to look northward when i saw a red-orange sphere/orb moving eastwards. because our property has an abundance of trees, we were not able to follow it for long (maybe 20-30 seconds we could see it. the night sky was clear. the object was between 300 to 500 ft. off the ground. no sound of any sort was coming from the object. no navigational lights on the object just a steady red-orange glow. directly north from where i live is brookhaven calabro airport so i know the patterns of the incoming and outgoing air traffic. this is not the first time i've seen an object like this but this is actually the closest i've been to it, which was less than a mile. not sure of its size as there was nothing in the backround to compare to, only the trees in the foreground. i tried my best to see the object again but to no avail. my initial reaction was that it was perhaps a small plane on fire but there was not a smoke trail following it nor have i heard any reports today of a fire/crash. the object was flying slowly and low enough which makes me believe i was not the only one to veiw it.
content.summary: Red-orange sphere moving eastwards.....

content.detailedDescription:
Sitting on my porch talking with neighbors when i looked up and seen a red light that looked like a fireball, i thought it was a plane at first. it was moving slowly towards lake erie, i was waiting for it to turn towards hopkins airport but it continued north east. then within 3 minutes or so it just disappeared fading slowly. it was very unusual, it was not a plane, we live by the airport and see planes all the time.
 
the object flew at a normal speed as i could tell, and flew in a basic straight line. i just stared at it because at first i thought it was a plane until it disappeared then i was confused. i did not tell my husband who was talking with neighbors (who is now mad about it) but today friends of mine had seen it also and where asking if anyone had seen it so my husband wrote the sighting to mufon. there are pictures from the 4th and earlier from other people sightings that look like what i saw, i regret i did not et a picture.
content.summary: Red light in sky in northeast sky thought was a plane but it disappeared instantly

content.detailedDescription:
Around 10:45 pm on july 4, 2010 we had three separate objects fly overhead. we had finished our fireworks display about 20 minutes earlier. there were 10-12 people who all saw the lights. across the street another 4-5 people saw it as well. one person said it was a hot air balloon with the burners lit. we quickly shot that thought down.

 the sightings were a few minutes apart. the first object flew in from the sw going east by ne. i would say at a height of 2000-3000 ft up.Air speed was 300 -400 mph based on what a single engine plane appears to be flying over head. it was two three times faster then that.  no noise was heard. in about 30 seconds we could not see it anymore. i contacted the local police department via 911 and asked if anyone else was reporting what we where seeing. they stated no.

about two to three minutes later, another light came in from the south and turned and followed the path of the first one. i called the police again and said we just saw another light exactly like the first one. they asked if we wanted an officer dispatched and we said yes. again, we heard no sound from the object. hot air balloons don't turn 90 degrees like the second object.

we all were like what are these things. everyone was watching them until it just disappeared out of sight.

a few of us gathered in the street talking about it. when the third object appeared; this one came in from the south by southeast. it flew to the same area as the first two objects and changed direction following the path of the previous two. i pulled out my cell phone and got 3 pictures one very bright. one showing the object smaller and further away and the last; it just looks like a red orange dot in the sky.

the police showed up around 5 minutes later. the officer was a women who appeared she did not want to be bothered with us. i told her we saw three objects and they all headed east. she said she just came form that way and saw nothing. i said by time you got the call they probably were over lake michigan already. she made no official report.

i believe in what i saw, everyone saw the same thing. i guess i was the most excited by it. no fear it was like whoa cool. 
they just flew off until we could no longer see them. each time we watched them for 15-30 seconds.

i have no cable to take the pictures off the phone so i had to email them to myself i hope they are clear.
content.summary: Three bright orange reddish rectangular objects seen by 12-15 people.

content.detailedDescription: I was not there. i went out after told by one witness to investigate. spoke w/an at sonoco gas station who said they have been around before. last nite sev. witnesses due to fireworks show. i have seen video& this is the. real deal.  must see video. please contact 4 details.  i am on my phone/must be brief here but will upload video. this was taken by. child & only one ufo but 4 were seen for a good 30-45 minutes. grew in size and turned red
content.summary: Caught on video. 4 objects witnessed by least 11 people.

content.detailedDescription:
Sitting outside camping with my family at a lake 8 miles north of appleton, mn.  we had no campfire going because the wind was very strong that night so we were just talking outside.  my brother and i noticed a bright glowing orange object moving from the northwest to the southeast.  seven other family members also observed this object.

it was like nothing any of us have seen before.  larger than all of the stars in the sky and a steady orange glow moving quite slow compared the speed of an airliner moving across the sky.  had a steady movement that we tracked for just a little over three minutes before it went out of our view behind the tree line.  

we all immediately thought and said "its a ufo".  overall very strange looking orange sphere.  i could not estimate the height as i have no idea how big it was other than bigger than the stars in the sky that night.
content.summary: Glowing orange sphere

content.detailedDescription: The three red orb shaped craft seperated from the bottom of a stationary large triangle. one of the crafts came within a hundred yards of us. my wife got scared and we went inside. these craft appeared to be curious about the fireworks .They were completely silent. the flew unconventionally and were definately intelligent controlled crafts. these were not planes helicopters or balloons . it was so real and close. hard to walk away from the sight.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Triangle craft released three red round crafts.

content.detailedDescription:
My girlfriend and i were enjoying the fireworks display in my subdivision.(located on indian park dr in murfreesboro, tn)
there were a lot of fireworks being set off by a lot of people who live around me. but this was certainly not a firework. a bright orangish circular light appeared, moving in a straight line above the apartment complex, then made a 90 degree turn until moving slowly out of sight. we both looked at each other with the same expression and said what in the world is that? my girlfrend said she thought it looked like a plane on fire. but it looked like it was moving too slow and made no airplane or helicopter noise. i was sorta freaked out to say the least and my girlfriend was too. we continued to watch the fireworks and about 10-15 minutes later, the same light re-appeared! i told my girfriend to keep it in her line of sight and i ran into my house and grabbed some binoculars. while looking through the binoculars, i really couldn't make out any more detail other than it was a big orangish glowing light moving slowly in the sky. the light finally started to dim. only when the light was out completely, was i then able to see the actual full shape and size of the object. this sent chills through my body. it was a deep dark, much larger black sphere, circular in shape. the actual size of the sphere made the orange light look small in comparison to the full shape of the object. i watched it through the binolculars until it went behind the rooftops of the apartments across the street. entire incident lasted from around 9:15pm - 9:40pm cst approx.
content.summary: Bright (glowing) orange light moving slowly in a straight line across the sky, then changing direction - disappeared, then re-appeared.

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i were cleaning up fireworks debris when he yelled at me to look in the sky.  approximately 150 feet up we saw a bright yellow/orange glowing object (not flaming, but very bright and glowing) slowly moving horizontally across the sky from the southeast to the northwest.  it made no noise.  we chased it by foot as far as we could until we were stopped by a thick tree line.  the object travelled across the sky at a slow, steady pace for at least one mile until we lost sight of the object.  our neighbor's son saw it as well.  last that night, still mystified by the sighting my husband sat outside for a few hours trying to see the object again when he saw a semi-transparent object in the sky that was oval in shape and moved horizontally across the sky in the approximately location where the first object was observed; however, this object did not emit any light as the first object.
content.summary: Glowing object flying horizontally, slow, from southeast to northwest.

content.detailedDescription: We live in omaha, and have a close afb, offut, or the hq for strategic air command for the us air force, so naturally i thought it was a plane/jet. well as it come closer the red blob, mistaken for blurry jet lights was now spherical, or at least circular, to high and nothing behind it for dimentional aspects, but it looks like a type of red plasma like fire in the center of a ring like a dull corona, and it was moving at top speeds based on the appearance of it's altitude making a full horizon to horizon pass in about 20 seconds, but this was not a satellite, it did not make a curved pass like a satellite would following the earth's orbit, this was inside the orbit and actually appear to stop for a second. omaha has a lot of celebratory activity the days leading up to and on independance day. without being exagerating, there were so many firework displays from private citizens, that all of the metro area look like it was under a dense fog advisory...But it was all just firework smoke. this occured on the 3rd, and 4th, and i thought it was a firework after i knew it wasn't an aircraft, and got the neighborhood out to confirm i wasn't being fooled by a prank, or my eyes deceiving me. this was my 3rd encounter, the first being 15 years ago when i saw a grey/white sphere with no markings or lights over tucson arizona during daylight after looking directly above me.
content.summary: Red sphere with halo around it making horizon to horizon pass from east to west over omaha.

content.detailedDescription: At 9:45pm july 4th 2010 me and my wife were watching some neighborhood firework displays.  around 10pm we were watching the larger fireworks, the ones that go up into the sky and explode.  as we watched a few of these my wife pointed to the sky and said "what is that light up there?"  when i looked i noticed a round ball of orange light with light trailing behind it.  at first i thought it was a firework but then realized how far up in the sky it was.  i watched this light for about 3 minutes until it dissapeared into the sky going east.  as this light was moving from west to east it would turn and go higher then back down to its original altitude.  this was one of the strangest things i have ever seen in my life and it actually gave me cold chills.  there were other families watching the fireworks display and they noticed the light too but we could not determine exactly what it was.  seemed like as quick as it came it was gone.
content.summary: Large orange ball of light traveling east from west in the sky over indiana traveling rather quick.

content.detailedDescription:
A group of us were in a yard having just watched the local fireworks when a neighbor pointed to the sky and asked, "what's that?"

we were in a 3 acre open field facing south toward the illinois river.
there was a glowing orange light moving from the south-southwest to the north-northeast.  it was silent, at appr: 5k alt and speed was approximately 150mph.  
we thought it might be a remaining incindiery from the fireworks, except for the speed and the fact that the light burned steady. there was some discussion as to chinese lanterns, but the speed was too much.  winds were only gusting up to 16 or 17mph. 
about 30 seconds later another transited along the same vector but on a slightly different path parallel to the first one.  this second one was viewed by the entire group.  i watched it disappear to the horizon maintaining it's altitude and speed.
finally, there was a third one that did the same thing.  my neighbor claims he saw a fourth one prior to everybody noticing the other three, but i did not witness it.  my neighbor also claims that he could make out a dome shape above the light, but i couldn't discern a shape.

i'm a combat veteran and have seen just about everything that there is in the sky.  i've seen tracer fire, flares, combat aircraft, ballistic devices, etc.  i can come up with no comparison for what i witnessed.
content.summary: Several fast moving orange lights moving at appr 5k altitude.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife & i were in our bedroom looking out at the fireworks and saw 2 groups of lights in a triangular formation traveling from the north then turning to the east.  then they just disappeared then we saw a row of more lights i would say it was about 15-20 crafts heading in the same direction, this lasted for about 20 minutes and we watched from our bedroom window at one point i saw a group of 5-6 craft form a odd shape triangle shape .  these were not fireworks they were some sort of aircraft. i have 110 hours in the air,studied aviation and these where not planes or helicopters as the lights were not flashing(blinking wing lights-red or green).
and you can see that its was a line of craft coming from the north.  which i thought was strange for that time of night and if they were military jets you can usually hear the noise.
content.summary: Rows of red & white lights not blinking traveling from the north to east.
